page.title: 05Wawne, farming.
page.content:
The soils round Wawne are a mixture of heavy boulder clay and 'carr' land, which is basically river alluvium with some peat.
{Dairy farming}predominates with cerial grown as a secondary crop, wheat and rape; occassionally beans. All the grassland is fertilized and takes the form of 'leys', which is grass grown to be cut for silage. After cutting the cattle are grazed on the stubble, as it is not cut right down to the ground.Most farm buildings are near the village, although more modern farm houses have been situated further away.
Two of the{seven}farms are owned by large companies. The other five are owner-occupied or rented.
